fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4144].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA retains the issue type from the previous issue any time the user creates a new issue in the same project. The default issue type will only appear each time the project is changed in the Create Issue screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow default issue type to be used all the time
* inline issue creation for Service Desk issues
 
h3. Workaround 
As per [Raising requests on behalf of customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER031/Raising+requests+on+behalf+of+customers], Agents can select a request type and create the request on behalf of a customer.
fields.summary: As an Agent, I would like to create issue using the default issue type instead of the 'last remembered' issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4142].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If an Event other than "Issue Created" is specified in POST Function for the Issue Creation in a Service Desk Project, the Approval workflow does not function correctly.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Cloud v3.3.0-OD-1000.82.0
* JIRA Service Desk Server up to 3.2.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Configure the [Approvals|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-service-desk-approvals-815569154.html] for your Service Desk Project where the Approval Step is on the Initial Status after Create.
# Edit the POST Functions on the Create Transition and change the "Fire Event" from "Issue Created" to something else; for testing use 'Generic Event' 
# In the Service Desk Portal, create a Request which requires approval 

h3. Expected Results
- Request Activity shows "Request requires approval"
- Approver is listed under 'Awaiting Approval'
- Approver receives notification that a Request is pending their Approval

h3. Actual Results
- Request is created however the Approver is not added to the request
- The Approver does not receive notifications nor can see the Request in their own Service Desk Portal 

How a Request normally appears:
!Default-IssueCreatedEvent.png|thumbnail!  
How a Request appears if there was a Custom Event on the Create Issue transition:
!CustomEvent.png|thumbnail!  
 
h3. Notes
If the Approver is also an Agent, he can Approve the request from Service Desk queue

h3.Workaround
Set the Event back to "Issue Created" on the Create Issue Transition POST Function
fields.summary: Service Desk Approval Does Not Work if Custom Event is Triggered on Issue Creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4140].
  {panel}

*Problem Statement*

Currently, if an unauthorized user tries creating a ticket through mail on JIRA, he/she won't receive any notification saying the ticket was not created.

*Suggested Resolution*

Trigger a mail notification when this happens, to let the user know that the ticket wasn't created on JIRA.
fields.summary: Notify unauthorized users about ticket submission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4139].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Service Desk Agent/Admin, sometimes it's important to notify the customer about a breached "due date" that can be specified on specific customer cases, differently from the SLA, which's a predefined value for all issues in a given SLA.
Currently, there isn't a way to manually customise the SLA for each issue created like one can do for the "due date" date field, as it would require an incredible amount of re-work.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be a good idea if the SLA fields could inherit, or be based on, other fields values which the user manually sets. 
Providing an option for the Agent/Admin to decide in which field he wants his SLA to be based on would be a good idea.
 
h3. Workaround 
Not available for now.
fields.summary: Make the SLA field customisable to inherit other field's values

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently it is not possible to list tickets in the queue to be sorted according to Created Time. It is only possible to sort according to Created Date only.
Or apart from that a column with tittle of Created time is not available. In case user is interested to have such information displayed.

h3. Suggested Solution 

To add a column as Created Time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4129].
  {panel}

h2. Current Situation

When an image/attachments with the similar file name is being attached to a comment. The previous comment with inline image/attachments will be pointed to the latest updated image.

h2. Use Case

At a support/helpdesk environment, user does not have control over the mail client that the customers use. Which in most of the case, image/attachments are pasted directly to the body of the mail. Causing the default file naming to be identical. 

This has seriously crippled the usability of Service Desk as the old comments (with similar file name) no longer represents the state that it should be in. 

To add to the pain, the incoming mail is being deleted upon creation. That removed the reference to track back and it causes confusion especially on a long running case where 4-5 inline image is added. They can only rely on the time recorded when the issue is added to reference it back.

h2. Proposed Solution

To have the ability to configure the attachments to be appended with time stamp. There should be a toggle in project level so that user get to choose if this only applies to specific projects.

Also could consider wiki markup with a timestamp column, to place that information to point the attachment to the right one.
fields.summary: Better Handling of Attachments with Same Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4127].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JQL If conditions can access outdated data if the condition check is performed before JIRA Core updated the corresponding indexes.

This behaviour is not deterministic.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* Cloud
* Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an automation rule with following components
## *When* comment added 
## *If* issue matches status = "Resolved"
## *Then* transition issue to reopen issue
# Create a new request
# Resolve the request with a comment

h3. Expected Results

The request was reopened by the automation rule.

h3. Actual Results

Occasionally the issue is still resolved, because the data the JQL query uses is outdated at the moment of the automation rule execution.
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Automation: JQL if condition accesses outdated data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4124].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When the public signup is disabled and an authorised user sends an email to create issue and at the same time CC a non-existing email address. The ticket will be created but the email address in CC field is ignored without any notification.
Currently JIRA can only create user account for new email address in CC field when public signup is enabled. However some customers do not want to expose the service desk project to every user (when public signup is enabled every user can have access to this project).

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option in JIRA so that when the public signup is disabled and an authorised user sends an email to create a ticket while CC a non-existing email address, a new user account should be created or a notification should be sent out to notify the sender.
The feature request [JSD-988|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-988] has been raised to notify the sender in this situation.
fields.summary: Add ability to create user account for the user in CC field when email is sent by an authorised user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4120].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the *Request Security* page of a service desk, for the category on whom could raise requests through email and customer portal, there is an option for _"Only people with any account on this JIRA instance"_. 

This option is very misleading if a user only has application access to Confluence. When this option is chosen, this user is able to view all service desks with the same _Resquest Security_ and create a ticket.

This could really affect the integrity of the service desk security.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the word {{JIRA}} to {{Cloud}}.
fields.summary: Misleading request security option in service desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4119].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

The 'status changed' automation trigger now triggers after leaving a specific status. Say the condition of the SLA is {{Issue status='Waiting for Customer}}, instead of triggering on transitioning to 'Waiting for Customer', the automation only triggers when it leaves 'Waiting for Customer'.

h2.Replication Steps
# Set an automation trigger and condition to the following, 'Status Changed' and 'Issue status='Waiting for Customer' . The THEN action can be a simple 'Add comment'.
# Now create a test ticket and try to trigger the automation by transitioning to 'Waiting for Customer'.
# The add comment is only triggered when leaving 'Waiting for Customer' status and not when reaching it.

h2.Workaround
There is currently no workaround for this besides changing the automation. Since it no longer triggers on arrival, you will have to adjust it to trigger it when leaving the previous status.
fields.summary: 'Status changed' automation trigger now executes after transitioning from a specific status instead of when trasitioning to a specific status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4118].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an agent, I often need to reference different cases in my JIRA Service Desk issue to the customer. My general workflow is: 
# I have an 'original' issue with a customer, and want to link another.
# Locate the issue though the JIRA issue navigator. 
# Identify the affected issue, open it up and get the customer portal URL. 
# Copy this link, and then paste this into the original issue.

This is is not a seamless experience for the agent. It would be easier to just copy the link from the issue navigator, and paste it in. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Ideally, it would be good if JIRA just understood what permissions a user had and then direct the user accordingly if they are already logged in as a customer, but don't have JIRA access.

h3. Workaround 
As mentioned above additional steps to get the correct link. 
Another workaround would involve using Text Expansion software that can automatically convert text in one format to another based on a script.
fields.summary: Automatically convert/redirect customers to the correct JIRA issue view based on a link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4117].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Link SD and Confluence instances
2. Create a service desk project.
3. Link a Confluence space to the SD project (e.g. use the Demonstration Space)
4. Create an issue in the service desk project having a summary that matches a Confluence page name (as the summary is used by the KB panel to run a Confluence page search to find KB articles). The KB panel should show a related article (at least) being the Confluence page mentioned previously.
5. Apply a label on the current issue that isn't on any Confluence page of the KB space, "unexisting-label" for example

h3. Expected results
JIRA issue labels shouldn't affect the Confluence pages returned in the KB panel, so applying any labels shouldn't affect the related articles list there (indeed, labels configured in the "Auto-search on request forms" section of the KB settings page should only restrict Confluence page search using the configured labels in the customer portal on request type form pages KB suggestions (and filtering out pages not having the configured labels) and nowhere else)

h3. Actual results
The JIRA issue labels are used in the KB search and make the panel related articles list being empty, same for the the KB panel search feature.

h3. Workaround
Temporarily removing issue labels filtering out expected Confluence pages result should fix KB panel search.
fields.summary: Issue labels are wrongly applied to restrict KB search from the KB panel in the issue view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4116].
  {panel}

We have a problem where our JIRA/JSD configuration is the following:
 * User directory order is set to
 ** 1) JIRA Internal Directory
 ** 2) Active Directory (Read-Only)
 * JIRA External User Management is ON
 * JSD Public Signup is ON

JIRA Version: 7.1.7
 JSD Version 3.1.7
 * All (internal) JIRA users are employees in Active Directory, and cannot change their password within JIRA. They must go through Active Directory. This is expected behavior.
 * All (external) JSD users are stored in the JIRA Internal Directory. We would expect that a public user who signed-up within JSD could be able to self-manage their own password resets regardless of how user management is configured in core JIRA. This is not the case.

When a public user (residing in JIRA Internal Directory) attempts to change their password, they get the following error message: "This instance does not support password reset. Please contact the system administrator." 

The ask / suggestion is to have "External User Management" be configurable independently at both the JIRA and JSD level.
fields.summary: Decouple External User Management Settings from Core JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4103].
  {panel}

Even at our fairly small company, it's surprisingly common for a user to sign up with their company email and use that to create cases in our Jira Service Desk web screens. Then at some point down the line their email address changes or they have multiple emails pointing to the same inbox.

Then, when we add a comment and they are notified, the notification goes to their original email (which they get), but when they respond, their email client sends the response using their new email address. When this happens Jira Service Desk create a new separate case.

It's difficult for us to track all the cases and comments and it's difficult for our customer to understand that they now have multiple Service Desk accounts and their issues are spread across the two.

What can be done about this? My thought is in a Service Desk account, allow us to specify alternate alias emails for that user. They wouldn't be used to send anything out, but would be allowed for incoming messages so they don't create a new issue each time they comment.
fields.summary: Handle users who reply via email from a different address
"Raise this request on behalf of" for customers?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4100].
  {panel}

*Note* : This feature request is created as an extension to JRA-2169 since JIRA and JSD is using a different mail handler. It will be desirable to have this feature implemented for both JEPP and JIRA Mail Handler, hence the creation of this feature request ticket.

h2. Current Situation

When an image/attachments with the similar file name is being attached to a comment. The previous comment with inline image/attachments will be pointed to the latest updated image.

h2. Use Case

At a support/helpdesk environment, user does not have control over the mail client that the customers use. Which in most of the case, image/attachments are pasted directly to the body of the mail. Causing the default file naming to be identical. 

This has seriously crippled the usability of JIRA as the old comments (with similar file name) no longer represents the state that it should be in. 

To add to the pain, the incoming mail is being deleted upon creation. That removed the reference to track back and it causes confusion especially on a long running case where 4-5 inline image is added. They can only rely on the time recorded when the issue is added to reference it back.

h2. Proposed Solution

To have the ability to configure the attachments to be appended with time stamp. There should be a toggle in project level so that user get to choose if this only applies to specific projects.

h3. Problem Definition

When navigating to the reports page on a Service Desk project, there are some reports that previously were presented on JIRA Service Desk 2.5.9 that are no longer presented out of the box on JIRA Service Desk 3, such as:

- Average Age Report
- Pie Chart Report
- Recently Created Issues Report
- Single Level Group By Report
- Time Since Issues Report

h3. Suggested Solution
 
As a JIRA Service Desk administrator, I'd like to have these reports presented as default reports as they were previously on JIRA Service Desk 2.

h3. Workaround 
As a workaround, it is possible to create these reports manually on the report page for the Service Desk project.
Another option is to use the [JIRA Charting Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.charting/server/overview ] to have these reports available on gadgets in the dashboard.

  {panel}

Problem Definition
The requests displayed under "My Requests" currently have a few options to display requests that are visible to a customer.

For the reporter, the choices are, to display issues "Created by me", "Where I am a participant" or both.
For the status, choices are "Open Requests", "Closed Requests" or both.
Lastly it is possible to filter based on request type.

Due to the fact that Service Desks can have more complex setups, these options might not properly cover the needs for a customer.

Suggestion

As an administrator, I want the ability to create a filter, and have the results of this filter as a selectable option under the "Open/Closed" request in order to facilitate better displaying of customer requests.

h3. Problem Definition
If a Service Desk Agent CCs a non-Customer User in an Email to a Service Desk Project, that non-Customer will have an account created for them and is added as a Request Participant on the Issue.

Note: Agents should be careful working outside of JIRA Service Desk. If the agent works with email only, they may create accounts unknowingly. If an agent CC's any email address while replying to a service desk notification, they will create an account for that address and add that account as a request participant.

h3. Steps to reproduce

1) As a JSD Agent, send an email to a Service Desk Project with non Customer email id cc'd to the email
2) The non Customer would have an account created and added as a Request Participant on the Issue

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option to Cloud Service Desk Admins to prevent new Customer Creation via Email when an Agent CCs a non-Customer on an email

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4083].
  {panel}

Hi there,

we have an Outlook addon for JIRA which allows to create Service Desk requests in behalf of customers. For this to work, we do need the following information, which we are currently grabbing from private API's. This lead to some problems for cloud systems recently, so it'd be great if you could add this to the official API.

What we use:
- Groups of the RequestTypes. This is not exposed via the offical API yet. We currently use:
/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<portalKey>/request-types (recently broke, throws 404)
/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<portalKey>/groups
/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/<portalKey/groups/<groupId>/request-types

In addition to the groups, which are not exposed via the official call, the assigned issue type is also missing (which we need to render our form). Would be great if these two things could be added here:
/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/<serviceDeskId>/requesttype

Thanks!
fields.summary: Make the REST API more functional (Groups, IssueTypes)

h4. +Scenario+

In some cases, new users log in JIRA for the first time and are presented with an Empty page, or other kinds of bad layouts. Since they're not yet familiar with JIRA interface, they may get confused as to what is going on.

Most probably this happens due to JIRA or Browser add-ons, but the first, unwanted impression to new users should be avoided.
h4. +Suggestion+

Implement a way to notify new users of what's going on in case they don't see what they're supposed to see upon first login.
h4. +Note+

[Service Desk Welcome Page is Empty|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Service+Desk+Welcome+Page+is+Empty] is an example of how a Browser add-on can spoil the Welcome page.
fields.summary: Better Handle Unexpected User Interface when Users Log in JIRA for the First Time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4075].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Notifications to Service Desk Agents use JIRA's standard notifications which link to Issues using URLs like {{[http://jira_url/browse/PROJ-###]}}, and it's not possible to make changes to this specifically for Service Desk Agents.
h3. Suggested Solution

Introduce a way to customize the URL so Agents instead receive emails where the URL is of the format {{[http://jira_url/projects/PROJ/queues/##/PROJ-###]}}. Alternatively, simply make it so that notifications to Agents in for Service Desk issues use the queue link when queues are defined.

The goal here being that when an agent clicks on a link in their email they see the issue in the Queue view, when appropriate, rather than the more generic Issue browsing view.
h3. Possible Workaround

It may be possible to define a custom set of *Events*, associate those with a specially defined set of email Templates, and then update all related Workflow steps so that the custom event is used instead of the generic ones.
fields.summary: Allow customization of URLs in emails to Service Desk Agents

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the Application link between JIRA Service Desk and Confluence is configured to use OAuth (without impersonation) it makes all requests anonymously. This causes problems when creating an article from the panel (as well as from the "Create KB Article" button on older server versions of JIRA Service Desk).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a JIRA Service Desk instance with a Confluence instance and configure the link to use OAuth (without impersonation).
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create a link under Project Settings > Knowledge Base to a space on the Confluence instance in step 1
# Go to the issue view for any issue in the project
# Click the "create an article" link from the KB Panel or the "Create KB Article" button to open the dialog.
# Fill in the form and click "Create"

h3. Expected Results
The user is taken to the Confluence editor to create a page.

h3. Actual Results
There is a 404 error and the page shows "Page not found".

h3. Workaround
Create the page in the space directly from Confluence using the Create button in the header.

h3. Notes
If the user happens to be logged and already have a draft open then they will see the editor when clicking "Create". However upon attempting to save the page they will see a Null Pointer Exception.
fields.summary: Creating an article from the JIRA issue view does not work with OAuth (without impersonation)

  {panel}

When screenshots or images are included in a mail sent to JIRA ServiceDesk, by default they are *+attached as thumbnails+*

When multiple screenshots are included, it is an _annoyance_ having to click thru every one in order to see them properly. However, *if screenshots were included at full size*, then it becomes much easier to read the Description or Comments.

The only workaround we know of is having to edit the *Description* or *Comment*, in order to remove the {{"}}{{|thumbnail!"}} tag on JIRA markup language. The more images a mail has, the more time consuming is this.

We want to force JIRA to display all images in issue description to always display at full size. At least, there should be a* global parameter* to set up such preference. I did not find any option in the admin screen for that. 

How do we achieve this ? Please help !

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4060].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

In a JIRA Service Desk, whenever an End-User submits a Request within an instance’s Customer Portal, if they miss a required field in the form, the error may not be visible on the screen.

For example, if I’m creating a new Request in someone’s Customer Portal, and I forget to fill in a Required field that isn’t visible in my window anymore, there isn’t any direct prompt that would warn me of the error. Unless I scroll back up and notice the error underneath the field itself, the Request page just looks like it lagged out and isn’t accepting the request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create request type with multiple fields, mark only the summary field required.
 # To make the form long, add field help with line breaks. The following repeated over and over will make the form long:
 ** 
{noformat}
 \\test \\test \\test \\test \\test \\test  


{noformat}

 # Create request in portal. Leave summary empty and scroll to where summary is no longer visible.
 # Attempt to submit request using create button
 ** Notice the form jumps slightly the first time you click create. This is the error appearing higher in the page. The error does not become visible on the screen.
 ** Clicking the create button again does nothing. The button itself appears to respond as it flashes when clicked. Nothing else happens.

h3. Expected Behavior

Error becomes immediately visible to customer so that they are aware that an error was encountered.
h3. Proposed Solutions:
 * List of the errors near the Create button
 * Help message next to the Create button, for example "Errors above! Scroll up, fix, and try submitting again"
 * Auto-Focus the window to the closest Error.
 * If multiple errors, auto focus or auto scroll to top-most error. The user would need to scroll down to create and would encounter the other errors that need to be fixed.
fields.summary: Required field error not easily visible when creating long requests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Service Desk Administrator, or Agent, I would like to be able to get more specific details about issues that breached specific SLA metrics.

Currently JQL lends itself to searching for issues based on given criteria, but currently, no function exists to be able to break down breached issues that breached within a given timeframe. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a few JQL functions that handle AFTER, BEFORE, DURING date operations so that issues that have breached within those times can be easily identified and added to filters, subscriptions, etc.  

h3. Workaround
No workaround currently exists for this product limitation.
fields.summary: Create JQL Functions for SLA metrics based on a specific timeframe.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In certain environments, agents have access to the inbox of the mail account that Service Desk uses for the mail channel. In this scenario, it is possible for the agent to manipulate customer satisfaction feedback ratings in the event that the customer replies to Closed\Resolved notification containing the satisfaction survey. If the reply includes the quoted body of the survey, the agent can follow the link and change the star rating. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Expire the feedback token after initial customer survey completion. Alternatively, disallow agent access to satisfaction feedback survey pages.

h3. Workaround

Use the Jira Service Management REST API to [delete the token property|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-properties/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-properties-propertykey-delete]

{noformat}curl --request DELETE \
  --url 'https://your-domain.atlassian.com/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/properties/feedback.token.key' \
  --user 'email@example.com:<api_token>'
{noformat}
fields.summary: Expire Satisfaction Feedback Token

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4054].

*Update 29th June 2021:*

*Hi all,*

*This ticket is effectively a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-178.* 

*The message on the above ticket is:* 

_*Following our announcement of acquisition of ThinkTilt, makers of Proforma, we are now planning out our integration of Proforma into Jira Service Management, which will resolve this ticket need.*_ 

_*We will update as we know more about timing, but expect several months for this integration to take place.*_ 

_*So happy to be updating this ticket and moving forward on this!*_

*All the best,*

*Liron Deutsch*

*Principal Product Manager, Jira Service Management*
{panel}
 

As an admin I would like to show additional fields in the customer portal when creating an issue. The fields should be hidden by default and will appear based on input into fields that show by default.

Example Use Cases:
 * Multi select custom field 'Reason' has 'Other' value. If it is selected, a text box custom field appears and customer is required to type in a comment
 * Date custom field 'Due Date' is not required. If Due date is filled in a multi select custom field 'reason' appears and is required
fields.summary: Show or hide field in portal based on another field value

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4049].
  {panel}

I would like to integrate further into our JIRA Service desk and the idea of a pre-populated link to a specific request type would be ideal.

For example:
* User clicks on public link
* User redirected to request
* User notices that the summary and the description are already pre-popuated with contextual information

h2. Implementation:
I suspect the most simple implementation would be URL parameters that pre-populate the summary/description.
Such as: {{https://<jira-base-url>/servicedesk/customer/portal/1/create/92?summary=Test&description=More%20Text%20for%20the%20description}}

The (better) alternative would be the ability to use headers but would be more complicated.

h2. Use Case:
* Dynamically generated support links throughout applications (such as "Report a problem with this document" or "Request access to this page")

Thanks!
fields.summary: Provide URL functionality for pre-populated summary/description
Allow custom time intervals for JIRA Service Desk reports
Date and Time Columns

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4039].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Cells Copied From a Spreadsheet Get Converted into an Image When Pasted In JSD

h3. Environment
* Chrome Version 51.0.2704.106 (64-bit)
* JIRA Service Desk Application v3.2.0-OD-18-002-D20160705T034522

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Chrome > access your instance
# Have a JSD project running (with description and attachment fields available)
# Open Excel > Create a table > Copy that table
# Open Customer Portal > Go to create a new request
# Paste this table in the description field

h3. Expected Results
- JIRA should paste the table within the description field.

h3. Actual Results
- JIRA is attaching the table as an attachment (image).
 
h3. Notes
- This works as expected on IE, Safari and Firefox (latest version)

h3.Workaround
Use one of the browsers mentioned above.
fields.summary: Cells Copied From a Spreadsheet Get Converted into an Image When Pasted In JSD

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4038].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

No 'Resolved issue' notification is sent, if the transition in the SD project has:
# A screen associated with the 'Resolution' field
# A post-function setting the field

Even if the ticket did not have previously a resolution set, if it's changed twice, the notification is not sent. For example, if the ticket was 'Unresolved', then transitioned to 'Done' via screen and to 'Declined' via post-function, the issue's history will show:
!issue_history.png|thumbnail!

As though the issue was not initially Unresolved, as we don't see an entry from 'Unresolved' to 'Done' first. The notification is not triggered.

According to [the documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html], the customer should receive a notification when the issue resolution is set:
{quote}
When a customer submits a request, they receive email notifications as the issue reporter when:
the request is created
* a comment is added to the request
* another participant is added to the request
* the request is resolved with a set resolution field
* the request is reopened with a cleared resolution field
{quote}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Create a transition that resolves the issue
# Create a post-function to set the 'Resolution' to some value, such as:
{code}The Resolution of the issue will be set to Declined.{code}
# Associate a screen to the ticket with the 'Resolution' field included
# Create and resolve the issue

h3. Expected Results
User is notification for both 'create' and 'resolve' transitions.

h3. Actual Results
Only 'create' in this case will trigger notification. No notification for when 'Resolving' the issue. This is also preventing Customer Satisfaction to be sent.
 

h3.Workaround
Remove either the post function or the field from the screen (or the screen completely from the transition).
fields.summary: Setting resolution twice is preventing 'Resolve Issue' notification in SD

Hello all, 

We are working on this issue. Your customers viewing experience will be very close to the Confluence experience. 
 * Your customers would be able to view the articles in a wider space than 700px (current)
 * The inline video will play within the article
 * Click on images will zoom into images
 * The styles of macros and table will be as it is in Confluence. 

We plan to ship this in the next quarter. 

Cheers, 

Joe.
{panel}

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4035].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Approvals AND Show transition in the customer portal configurations are not possible on workflows that has a slash "/" in the name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a workflow for SD project with a slash in the workflow name
# Choose a workflow step, click on the Configure link to Add Approvals
# OR Choose a transition, click on the Configure link to Show transition in the customer portal

h3. Expected Results
Configuration dialog appears
h3. Actual Results
the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found) shown in console and menu is not displayed

h3.Workaround
Copy the workflow to a new name without the slash and associate it to the project
fields.summary: Can not open Approvals or Transition in the CP configuring dialog in the workflow if the workflow name has a slash "/"

h3. Summary
When user use the "Where is my field?" functionality within a JIRA Service Desk issue to lookup a SLA field, the result given is incorrect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project (a default "Time to Resolution" SLA will be created with that project).
# Create an issue with in that project.
# View that issue in the View Issue screen.
# Click "*Admin > Where is my field?*" and enter the SLA field "Time to resolution"

h3. Expected Results
Showing that the field is present

h3. Actual Results
The 'Time to resolution' field is not present on the form you are viewing even the SLA field is right on the screen. (See the screenshot below)
 !2016-07-08_sla.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4026].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a customer has a Service Desk issue linked to another issue. It would be good to be able to set up an automation so that when a linked issue changes to a different state, the Support issue is also transitioned so that the Agent can take any required actions on the case.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a customer to set up an Automation trigger that would fire when a linked issue changes status to a specific state.
 
h3. Workaround 
Use a third party Automation to listen for relevant events such as the [JIRA Misc Workflow Extension|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmwe.jira-misc-workflow-extensions/server/overview].
fields.summary: Automation Trigger for linked issues status change

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4024].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an attachment is added to a service request, the link in the sent notification seems to be broken. 
Clicking on the link returns HTTP Status 400: "The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect"

\\
h3. Environment
Reproduces on:
- JIRA versions 1000.126.1 and 1000.110.0 
- JSD versions 3.2.0-OD-18-001-D20160629T013132 and 3.2.0-OD-17-002-D20160627T071458



\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a customer, create a service desk request
# As an agent, add an attachment to the request and use the attachment button to link the attachment in the comment
# Wait until the notification is sent out and check the Customer Mailbox.
# Click on the Attachment Hyperlink.

\\
h3. Expected Results
The link is downloaded correctly

\\
h3. Actual Results
You get HTTP Status 400: "The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect" returned by Tomcat.
 !Error-opening-link.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
The link in the notification, compared to the link to the same attachment in the customer portal seems to be missing the last parameter:
*Link in notification:* https://INSTANCE_URL/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10002/10002_sample.doc
 !Link-in-notification.png|thumbnail! 


*Link on customer's portal:* https://INSTANCE_URL/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10002/10002_sample.doc?fromIssue=10286
 !Link-in-customer-portal.png|thumbnail! 



\\
h3.Workaround
Copy the link from the customer portal and paste it into the comment
fields.summary: Attachment(s) link(s) broken in notification(s) sent to customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4020].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This feature *Include the linked issue's details* inside automation rules is not working properly. When a customer executes a transaction like ‘resolving’ an issue, the automation rule should add a comment to a linked issue. It does that but it adds a comment with wrong status.

Here is an example of that happens:

Issue ‘resolved’:

!Screen 1.png|thumbnail! 

Issue ‘comment’ with wrong status:

!Screen 2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira version - 1000.110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a issue.
# Link this issue to another one.
# Resolve one of this issues. (Add a resolution)
# See the comment added.

h3. Expected Results

Following the example above, it should be: JSD-48 RESOLVED "2" has been changed to a status of *Resolved* and it is actually returning JSD-48 RESOLVED "2" has been changed to a status of *Waiting for customer*.

h3. Actual Results

JSD-48 RESOLVED "2" has been changed to a status of Waiting for customer has been changed to a status of *Waiting for customer*.

h3. Notes
I was able to re-produce it in two other instances (dog-foods). When closing and re-opening some issues, it varies of the status the automation adds.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround for now.
fields.summary: Feature *Include the linked issue's details* inside automation rules is not working properly

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today, Service Desk Customers do not have the ability to edit an issue once it's created. There are times when the creator or the participants (Service Desk Customers) want to edit the Summary, Description, Priority or etc but they couldn't.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow fields to be configurable to be editable by the creator or the participants (Service Desk Customers)
* Summary
* Description
* Priority
* Link issue (Suggestion should be disabled due to security reason)

  {panel}

h2. Summary

Regarding the new feature released in JSD Cloud where the customer now can transition issues from their portal. The customer's transition is not blocked by the transition's validator in the workflow. 

h2. Steps to reproduce problem:
{quote}Validator:
If a value for field Comment is not provided during the transition, show the following error: This field is required.{quote}
Set above validator to a workflow transition. Make transition accessable in customer portal. Transition issue from customer portal. Leave Comment field blank, and confirm transition. 

h2. Expected behaviour:
Error message: "This field is required." Transition not made.

h2. Actual behaviour:
Transition successful. No error message. 

h2. Workaround
No current workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Customer portal transition - validators not applied

  {panel}

h3. Problem Description
Today, customers can click the rating scale to indicate their level of satisfaction, which depicted by stars. However, there's no description for the rating scale to indicate the levels of satisfaction.
 !current.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
Allow an admin to add description to the rating scale to explain what it means to rate 2 stars or 4 stars or so
 !improvement.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Edit the soy template from {{jira-servicedesk-3.1.x/servicedesk/notifications/feedback/service-request-feedback.soy}}
(i) Please note that this is considered as customization and it falls outside of our Support scope as per the [Atlassian Support Offerings|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-offerings-193299636.html]. Please raise a question in [Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/?_ga=1.42900709.1192140082.1438935935] if you need further assistance.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3996].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Service Desk Agent, I would like to see if an E-mail notification to a customer has not successfully left the Mail Queue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Raise a flag that shows if there are Mail items in the outbound mail queue that have not been sent, or relevant items in the Outbound Error queue.

Use Service Desk Automation to bring the issue to the Agent's attention. 
 
h3. Workaround
- Have a System Administrator check the Mail queue for any problems. 
- Use Third-party monitoring software to flag errors as they are reported in the Outbound mail logs. 
- Trigger an event/update on the affected issue through an API call to bring the problem to the attention of the Agent.
fields.summary: Provide a warning or alert if a notification to a customer has failed to send
Ability to notify customers when issue is moved between projects.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3993].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior
Automation "when a linked issue is transitioned" is not triggered if the transition does not result in the change of the issue status. Examples of transitions that do not change status include: 
* Initial "Create" transition
* Transitions that loop back to the same status

h3. Suggested Behavior

When linked issue automation rule should be triggered by any transition including the create transition and other transitions that do not result in status change. 

*Use case:*
For example a service desk admin may not want an agent to put a service desk request into waiting on dev unless a dev ticket is created. They could add a condition to the transition so that only a certain user or group can transition the request to waiting for dev. Then they create an automation rule that automatically transitions the service desk request into waiting for dev as soon as the dev.
 * For example the agent may use the "Create Linked Issue" menu option to create the linked issue directly from the JIRA Service Desk request. 

h3. Workaround 
Create another status so outgoing transition from that status is evaluated.
fields.summary: Automation WHEN linked issue should be triggered by transitions without status change
